stories.text:
I am looking for an updated list of programs that give equity free funding or grants to a for-profit startup. I had earlier found a resource[0] and had bookmarked for future. However, seems it is not updated anymore.

Any updated list or any new programs that I can apply to for an equity free funding or the lack of better phrase "free money"?

[0]: https://lootstrap.com/equity-free-startup-accelerators
stories.title: Ask HN: Updated list for Equity Free Funding or Grants to a for-profit startup?

stories.text:
Link: https://www.haberdashervcs.com

I'm seeking open-minded and slightly patient alpha testers for Haberdasher: a version control system for huge repos. It combines a git-like workflow with a large-scale database (HBase). Millions of folders, millions of commits, and files up to 1GB.

What started as a lockdown project to stay sane has blossomed into a crude prototype. Obviously from the website it's only got bare functionality, but I wanted to start showing it around and get some thoughts. If you'd like to kick the tires, a very short sign-up form is on the website.

For the curious: history is stored in HBase, and large files are shunted to HDFS. Both the server and client are in Java, and for more info:

- The workflow is documented at: https://www.haberdashervcs.com/docs

- You can browse the source at: https://www.haberdashervcs.com/browseHd -- it's currently under a source-available license

Who am I? I'm Yash, and I'm an engineer in the southern US who's shuffled between big companies and indie projects for years. You can email me at: yash@haberdashervcs.com. Thanks for reading.
stories.title: Seeking alpha testers: Haberdasher is a modern VCS for huge repos
